oai_dc:dc.dc:title: 34-star US flag from the St. Louis Arsenal
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Owned by Capt. Eben E. Richards of the Missouri State Militia, this wool bunting flag was flown in actions very early in the war around Camp Jackson in St. Louis and the attempted capture of the arsenal there by Confederate troops. These 1861 actions by the largely German militias of St. Louis helped preserve Missouri for the Union.
